intro: Oscularia primiverna, commonly known as the early spring dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in early spring. Oscularia primiverna is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
